page.title: 18TOURISM IN LINTON
page.content: St. Mary's church was built before the 1300's.The north porch was built in Norman times.The right side of the church was built by the Paris family, but the left side was built by the Millucernt family.In July there is a flower festival,which attracts about 2000 visitors a year. The water tower is placed on Rivey hill and it can be seen for miles around,it is the symbol on the Linton Village College school badges. The Mill is no longer in use.It was a corn mill built between 1800 and 1900. It is not the biggest tourist attraction. Many of the cottages on each side of the High Street are old and attractive,because of the timber,flint walls,thatching and carved plaster. C.Hazlewood,P.Buttle,D.Osmond,N,Hall, P.West.
